Change has been successfully merged

8 is the latest approved patch-set.
No files were changed between the latest approved patch-set and the submitted one.
Same here as Willy's comment below. I guess we could have these commented out for users to enable in their own local bbappend if required (as an example for them to copy over)
Ok, commented out it and moved to below as an example. Thanks
I don't think this override exists on OpenBMC. Should be removed and if needed, I need to update to on the gBMC side.
Got it, let me move the override to downstream. Thanks
Hm. Would it be possible for this to run after glome-config.bb and therefore remove what we put in from glome-config.bb (the intended config)?

Maybe this should just be the default in the upstream BB recipe.

You can't have 2 different recipes with conflicting files.

I guess we would need to change the meta-phosphor first. It MAY be better to separate out the 2 CLs so that this is meta-google only and the new one (probably before this in the chain) is meta-phosphor just touching the glome.bb file

Right, as William said, installing the same file from two different recipes results in a conflict error.

Hi Brandon,
I do not catch the point - what should/can we do in the meta-phosphor? Do we have the glome.bb file there? I can't find it.
I'm a dummy - I was thinking of a different recipe that was promoted up to meta-phosphor. Let's make the change here together in meta-google as it's in meta-google

Just to move this forward - I think perhaps we should follow what William suggested then?

`Maybe this should just be the default in the upstream BB recipe.`
ah, I understood, thanks for the clarification. Removed the sample config in the bb file.

Do we have to mention that we now have to have glome-config as a requirement since we remove the default glome config?

Should we perhaps have a dependency set up so that glome-config is always installed when glome_git is installed?

(maybe with DEPENDENCY set in glome_git to glome-config?)
Yes, that makes perfect sense. Thanks.
Thanks Leo, that looks correct for me
We can take this out now I believe - we should probably replace this with something like - this is required to replace the glome/config that is removed in glome_git.bb

it was mentioned in an unrelated review that we should try to avoid bash stuff https://github.com/openembedded/meta-openembedded/pull/597#discussion_r954377425

Maybe good practice to do so.

Maybe do

```
if not d.getVar("GLOME_PUBLIC_KEY") 
```
instead

Do you mean to mix python code in the shell script? I personally like python much more than shell script, but will it be more complicated if they are mixed?

In the attached thread, my understanding is that the reviewer suggested not to use `[[ ... ]]``, because it works on bash but not on dash (so we use `[ ... ]`).

The important thing is to avoid bashisms.

You cannot mix python and shell in a single bitbake function.  Since this is a 'bbappend' you have to use whatever language the recipe/bbclass that created 'do_install' originally used, which is shell in this case.

Understood, thank you for the clarification.

I checked again the bb file in this CL and the common bashisms (from https://mywiki.wooledge.org/Bashism), there should be no bashisms here (by assuming `echo 'msg' >&2` is ok).

nit: maybe do python string format instead and get the value from d.getVar. but we already use the `${WORKDIR}` directly. Maybe its fine.

It's fine eitherway, but trying to see what's best practice.

Ack, same as previous comment. 

I may be wrong, and I also want to follow the best practice. Please let me know if I miss anything.
Has this been tested with the latest change? (I think perhaps RDEPENDS is not needed since we don't use the glome-config within the bitbake file here for the install or anything).

Yes, I tested every patch on the real machine when it is pushed.

- If we remove this `RDEPENDS`, we need to add `glome-config` in the `OBMC_IMAGE_EXTRA_INSTALL`. (otherwise, the `config` won't be installed)
- If we have this `RDEPENDS` here, we don't need to have `glome-config` in the `OBMC_IMAGE_EXTRA_INSTALL`

So, I think it may be more appropriate to have `RDEPENDS` here.
Wow good catch - surprised no one caught this yet
Is this directory even being used if this was broken? Can we remove it?

Looks like I got "User not approved, see admin, no CI" after Aug.28.

Is it the cause that I can't submit this CL? I think I have my personal account in the Google CLA list (my google account is also linked to my personal account in both github and gerrit)

Does anyone know what I can do next?
Hmm, yes it's most likely the CLA list - and yes not getting the CI to run is the cause of this not being able to be pushed
I'm in the CLA list, but not in the `openbmc/ci-authorized` and `google/ci-authorized` groups. Filed a ticket to Nancy.
This does not depend on a glome-config package. That is purely added separately.

Because the sample config is removed from `glome`, if we remove this `RDEPENDS` here as well, the `config` won't exist at runtime.

An alternative is to add `glome-config` in the `OBMC_IMAGE_EXTRA_INSTALL`.

(Brandon had the same comment in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/56618/comment/2601c0bd_b02ec029/)
Right, which is why you should just be adding it to OBMC_IMAGE_EXTRA install. When glome_git.bb is migrated to another meta layer it won't have this RDEPENDS.

Oh, are you saying the `OBMC_IMAGE_EXTRA_INSTALL` in https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-google/recipes-phosphor/images/obmc-phosphor-image.bbappend? I did not know we have it in upstream, I thought we overwrite it in the downstream only.

If that's the case, this is the follow-up CL: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/56968
